qas.question: Why would a knuckle -space count be used to determine months?
A knuckle count is a month of how many days?
The space between knuckles is what kind of month?
What are held together for a knuckle-space month count?

plausible_answers.text: count knuckle, space, knuckle, space through the months

qas.question: What method for determining months is dependent on language?
What junction is counted for February?

context: A <a0_0>language-independent<a0_0/> alternative used in many countries is to hold up <a3_0>one's two fists<a3_0/> with the index knuckle of the left hand against the index knuckle of the right hand. Then, starting with January from the little knuckle of the left hand, <b4_0>count knuckle, space, knuckle, space through the months<b4_0/>. A knuckle represents a month of <a1_0>31<a1_0/> days, and a space represents a <a2_0>short month<a2_0/> (a 28- or 29-day February or any 30-day month). The junction <b5_0>between the hands<b5_0/> is not counted, so the two index knuckles represent July and August.
